events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim for damages sustained.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured car in a collision.
An agent was successfully assigned to the case to assist the customer throughout the claim process.
The customer's claim was acknowledged, reassuring them that their case is being handled promptly.
The insurance company requested additional documents including photos of the vehicle and a police accident report.
All requested documents including vehicle damage photos and official collision report were submitted by the customer.
The investigation into the claim began to verify the circumstances and assess the extent of the vehicle damage.
The investigation was completed successfully confirming the liability and validating the damage reported in the claim.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer based on the investigation findings and coverage limits.
The customer provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the clarity of the settlement offer.
The claim was formally approved after all internal reviews and customer agreement on the settlement terms.
Payment corresponding to the approved settlement was issued to the customerâ€™s designated account promptly.
The claim was officially closed after the settlement payment was confirmed received by the customer.
All case files and documentation were archived securely for future reference according to company policy.
